Message.Title: even a nitwitt like coulter finally gets it
Message.Msg: Ann Coulter shocked Sean Hannity on Wednesday when she conceded that she thinks Republicans should let tax rates for the rich go up. After Coulter started to say that Republicans should concede on taxes on the very rich, Hannity wondered why the House didn't just pass a bill extending the Bush tax cuts for everyone. "OK fine, let's do that, but in the end, at some point, if the Bush tax cuts are repealed and everyone's taxes go up, I promise you Republicans will get blamed for it," she said. "It doesn't mean you cave on everything, but there are some things Republicans do that feed into what the media is telling America about Republicans." "So are you saying that, for PR purposes, that they should give in to Obama on the tax rate?" Hannity asked. "Not exactly, I--" Coulter said, before stopping herself and saying, "Well, yeah, I guess I am." "You're saying capitulate to Obama?" Hannity stammered. "We don't have a revenue problem, Ann." "We lost the election, Sean!" Coulter replied. Other right-wing pundits, such as Bill Kristol, have echoed Coulter's argument. Kristol famously said that it wouldn't "kill the country" if taxes on millionaires went up.

Message.Title: Rudolph the Russian from Moscow
Message.Msg: There was a Russian communist who lived in Moscow. One cold January day he went for a walk. When he came home his wife asked him, "How's the weather, Rudolph?" He answered, "It's raining, Dear." She replied, "Raining? In Moscow? In January? Are you sure, Rudolph?" He replied, "Yes, Dear, it is raining." She replied, "Are you certain? How can it be raining in the cold of winter?" He replied, "Rudolph the Red knows rain, Dear."

Message.Title: all 38 no votes were republicans who even peed on GH Bush and bob dole to vote no
Message.Msg: ajoles pubs, led by huge ajole rick santorum: All 38 “nay” votes were cast by Republicans. Among its most vocal supporters were Republican war veterans, including President George H.W. Bush and former senator Bob Dole, who was injured in World War II and made a rare return to the Senate floor Tuesday to observe the vote and lend his stature. Other conservatives were deeply suspicious of the United Nations, which would oversee treaty obligations. Those who opposed the treaty included former senator and Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum, the father of a developmentally disabled child who had traveled to Capitol Hill last week to encourage fellow Republicans to vote no. He and other conservatives argued that the treaty could relinquish U.S. sovereignty to a U.N. committee charged with overseeing a ban on discrimination and determining how the disabled, including children, should be treated. They particularly worried that the committee could violate the rights of parents who choose to home school their disabled children.

Topic.Title: the Okies and Arkies weren't worth saving either, right? & wow, W spent a trillion on Baghdad?

Message.Msg: What's wrong with German? More likely would have been Russian. If FDR hadn't messed with the economy it might of recovered in a year instead of 8 years. FDR has all time record of unemployment over 8% for about 96 months. Unemployment only came down as he drew workers out of the market to make them soldiers and support. (Boy Barry must be really disappointed that he can never surpass his fascist hero! He allowed U/E rate to dip below 8% just to win an election!) If you are familiar with the military situations in Germany & Russia then you KNOW that the Russians would have won eventually anyway. Among other things, the Russians had Old Man Winter fighting for them. Difference is all of Europe would be speaking Russian now! Maybe the USA too! The only reason FDR got into European campaign was to prevent Stalin from over running all of Europe. And we might have won even better if we had real capitalism working for us instead of FDRs fascist, state run capitalism.

Topic.Title: Stupid people overwhemingly believe Democrats can solve fiscal cliff problem

Message.Msg: Fiscal Cliff - a made up problem that doesn't need solved. Allow the Bush Tax Cuts to expire 100% for everybody! I am tired of Democrats claiming that all the problems in the world will be solved if Bush Tax Cuts go away. Allow "payroll tax cut" to expire - it will strengthen Social Security! Force the democrats to create a new Obama Omnibus Plan for Spending (OOPS)!!!!! .
